intro: Duguetia marcgraviana, commonly known as the golden star vine, is a climbing plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a glossy surface and emits a sweet fragrance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural collections.
